ch4.tcp
Class TCPSenderTahoe

java.lang.Object
  ch4.tcp.TCPSender
      ch4.tcp.TCPSenderTahoe
public class TCPSenderTahoe
extends TCPSender

TCP Tahoe implementation of a sender.

Note: If you are in doubt or some of this code is conflicting your textbook, please check the ultimate sources: RFC 2581 and RFC 2001.
Do not rely on any textbooks for precise details!
Read the textbook(s) for high-level understanding of the material; read the RFCs for precise details.

Author:
Ivan Marsic

Constructor Detail

TCPSenderTahoe

public TCPSenderTahoe()
Method Detail

onExpiredTimeoutTimer

protected void onExpiredTimeoutTimer()
Helper method, called on the expired timeout timer. Also, after this kinds of event, the sending mode in any TCP is always reset to slow-start.

onThreeDuplicateACKs

protected void onThreeDuplicateACKs()
Helper method, called on three or more duplicate ACKs. Tahoe sender doesn't care about the number of duplicate ACKs as long as it's at least three. Also, after this kinds of event, the sending mode in TCP Tahoe is always reset to slow-start.

processAcks

public int processAcks(TCPSegment[] acks_)
Description copied from class: TCPSender
Processes ACKs received from the receiver. Checks for duplicate ACKs. May detect timeout timer expiration. Informs about the transmission outcome, as one of the options: TCPSimulator#SUCCESS, TCPSimulator#DUP_ACKx3, or TCPSimulator#TIMEOUT.

Specified by:
processAcks in class TCPSender
Parameters:
acks_ - The acknowledgements array, as received from the receiver.
Returns:
Returns a summary about the outcome of the previous transmission.

processAcksCongestionAvoidance

protected boolean processAcksCongestionAvoidance(TCPSegment ack_)
Helper method to process an individual acknowledgement segment in the congestion avoidance transmission mode. Determines if this is a duplicate acknowledgement and reports it.

The method assumes that the input argument is never equal to null.

Parameters:
ack_ - The current acknowledgement segment, to be processed.
Returns:
Returns true if this is a duplicate acknowledgement, false otherwise.

processAcksSlowStart

protected boolean processAcksSlowStart(TCPSegment ack_)
Helper method to process an individual acknowledgement segment in the slow start transmission mode. Determines if this is a duplicate acknowledgement and reports it.

The method assumes that the input argument is never equal to null.

Parameters:
ack_ - The current acknowledgement segment, to be processed.
Returns:
Returns true if this is a duplicate acknowledgement, false otherwise.

resetMonitoringVariables

protected void resetMonitoringVariables()
Helper method to reset the variables monitoring the signs for packet loss. The packet loss is detected by observing one or both of these events:
  • Three (or more) duplicate acknowledgements, monitored by the variable TCPSender#dupACKsGlobal;
  • Timeout timer expiration, monitored by the variable TCPSender#timer.

send

public void send(TCPSegment[] segments_,
                 int rcvWindow_,
                 boolean lostPacket_)
TCP Tahoe implementation of the send() method.

Specified by:
send in class TCPSender
Parameters:
segments_ - The array of segments, to be filled in this method.
rcvWindow_ - The size of the currently available space in the receiver's buffer.
lostPacket_ - Informs whether or not a packet loss was detected for the previous transmission.
See Also:
TCPSender.send(ch4.tcp.TCPSegment[], int, boolean)
